Portuguese-era case resolved by Supreme Court 78 yrs after Independence
description: The Supreme Court upheld a 1974 decision regarding land rights in Dadra and Nagar Haveli, resolving a dispute stemming from Portuguese colonial rule. The court dismissed appeals against a High Court decision, affirming the government's power to reclaim land previously granted by the Portuguese administration. Justices expressed concern over lingering colonial-era disputes in independent India.

description: A significant 6.2-magnitude earthquake struck northwest Venezuela, causing buildings to shake and prompting evacuations across several states and neighboring Colombia. The quake, with its epicenter near Mene Grande in Zulia state, was felt in major cities like Caracas and Maracaibo.

title: Abhishek Sharma’s sister sends heartwarming message after Asia Cup heroics
description: Abhishek Sharma's impressive 75 propelled India to a 41-run victory over Bangladesh in the Asia Cup Super 4, securing their spot in the final. Despite his run-out denying him a century, his sister Komal remains optimistic, crediting Yuvraj Singh's mentorship. Sharma also broke records, hitting 17 sixes in the tournament.

title: Karnataka HC rejects X plea, backs social media regulation
description: The Karnataka High Court dismissed X Corp's petition against content takedowns, asserting that Indian constitutional law prevails over American free speech standards. The court emphasized the necessity of regulating social media, particularly to protect women's dignity, and stated that foreign corporations cannot claim fundamental rights in India. It upheld the government's Sahyog portal as a legitimate tool for combating cybercrime.

title: India may buy more oil from US, says Piyush Goyal
description: India signals potential increase in US oil imports amid pressure to diversify from Russian crude, aiming to strengthen energy security and reduce the trade deficit. Discussions between Indian and US officials are ongoing to finalize a trade deal, addressing concerns like secondary sanctions and reciprocal tariffs. The US expresses strong interest in expanding energy cooperation with India across various sectors.

Following public outcry and multiple FIRs, the Assam CM has blacklisted the festival organizer involved and promised a thorough investigation.

description: Near the subway, the lorry belonging to Chennai Corporation rammed into his vehicle and dragged it for a few yards

title: Two bank employees arrested for fraudulent transactions
description: The investigation revealed that Saminathan, along with Prasad and other employees, had pledged gold ornaments in the names of inactive account holders by forging their signatures, and fraudulently obtained loans.

title: Will AI help fix India’s energy demand or will its own needs surge?
description: A McKinsey report has estimated that the annual global demand for data centre capacity could rise at 19-22% from 2023 to 2030, reaching 171-219 GW, against the total current demand of 60 GW. To avoid a deficit, at least twice as much data centre capacity built since 2000 will have to be in place in less than a quarter of the time

title: Asia Cup: India’s fielding under fire- Chakravarthy blames 'Ring of Fire' for team's fielding woes
description: India may be unbeaten in the Asia Cup, but their fielding has been a major concern, with 12 catches dropped so far, nine in the last two games. Varun Chakravarthy admitted there can be no excuses and stressed the need to improve ahead of the final, even as he detailed how bowling adjustments and match experience are boosting his confidence.

title: NMC turns 5, with no patient appeals heard
description: The National Medical Commission (NMC) has faced criticism for rejecting all patient complaints in its five years of existence, despite its mandate to regulate the medical profession in the public interest. A draft amendment allowing patient appeals to the Ethics and Medical Registration Board (EMRB) has stalled.

title: Delhi HC notes redesign of currency in policy realm, asks RBI to consider visually impaired in next series

title: Asia Cup: After Haris Rauf; PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi gets into jet-downing controversy
description: The Asia Cup is marred by political gestures as Pakistan Cricket Board chairman Mohsin Naqvi endorsed controversial actions, including a fighter-jet gesture, sparking outrage. This follows similar provocations by players like Haris Rauf and Sahibzada Farhan. While Pakistan faces criticism, India's on-field performance, highlighted by Abhishek Sharma and Kuldeep Yadav, secured their spot in the Asia Cup final.

This procurement aims to bolster India's air capabilities amid concerns about regional adversaries and technological advancements.

title: ‘Despicable’: Trump condemns Dallas ICE shooting; blames 'left-leaning' Democrats
description: President Trump condemned the deadly shooting at the Dallas ICE Field Office, attributing the violence to radical leftists and their rhetoric against law enforcement. He cited threats from domestic extremist groups like ANTIFA and announced plans to dismantle domestic terrorism networks.

title: Brittany Mahomes speaks out; constant attacks revealed; NFL spotlight toll
description: Brittany Mahomes, wife of Chiefs' quarterback Patrick Mahomes, has faced criticism from fans for her outspoken opinions on social media. She addressed the backlash, acknowledging the need to be more selective about what she shares publicly. In the past, controversial interactions with fans, including a heated exchange on X, sparked outrage. Now, she seems to be avoiding controversial statements.

description: The suspect has been identified by a law enforcement official as 29-year-old Joshua Jahn. The official could not publicly disclose details of the investigation and spoke to The Associated Press on condition of anonymity

title: Ladakh violence planned, not spontaneous: Officials
description: The central government believes the Ladakh violence was premeditated, despite scheduled talks with Ladakhi representatives. Officials question the motives behind the violence, pointing to Sonam Wangchuk's past calls for protests and Congress leaders' inflammatory statements. The government suspects a conspiracy to incite youth and reaffirms its commitment to finding solutions for Ladakh's empowerment.

description: The Supreme Court is set to hear petitions regarding lowering the age of consent, with amicus curiae Indira Jaising arguing that adolescents are capable of mature consent due to earlier puberty. Interveners, however, fear it could lead to exploitation and child marriages, advocating for case-by-case evaluation instead of blanket immunity under the Pocso Act.

description: The Election Commission has scheduled biennial elections for four Rajya Sabha seats in Jammu & Kashmir, vacant since February 2021, and a bypoll for a Punjab seat after Sanjeev Arora's resignation. Polling for all five seats is set for October 24, with counting to follow the same day.

description: India is set to receive another 8-10 cheetahs from Botswana or Namibia in December, with plans to acquire a similar number from Kenya next year. These additions will expand the cheetah population across four landscapes, including the prepared Nauradehi wildlife sanctuary and Banni grasslands. Currently, India hosts 27 cheetahs in Kuno and Gandhisagar, with hopes for new births in Gandhisagar.

A Rs 15,034 crore investment will upgrade medical colleges and hospitals, aiming to improve healthcare and address doctor shortages, especially in underserved areas. Additionally, a Rs 2,277 crore DSIR scheme will bolster India's R&D ecosystem.

description: CBSE will conduct class X and XII board exams starting February 17 next year, introducing a two-session model for class X. This initiative aims to reduce student stress and align with global assessment systems, with around 45 lakh candidates expected to appear.

description: The Election Commission now mandates Aadhaar authentication for online voter applications, including new enrollments and corrections, via OTP verification. This 'e-sign' requirement, implemented in September, aims to match applicant details with Aadhaar records. While online applications require Aadhaar, physical forms remain an option for those without it, ensuring accessibility.

title: KRERA can’t impose fee for late audit statements, quarterly updates from promoters: Karnataka High Court
Savannah James opens up; lost herself young; life as LeBron’s wife & mom
description: Savannah James, wife of NBA star LeBron James, recently shared her journey of self-discovery on her podcast, 'Everybody's Crazy.' She revealed feeling lost in her roles as a wife and mother, admitting her identity was consumed by her family. Savannah emphasized the importance of reclaiming personal time and interests, even taking solo trips to rediscover herself beyond her family responsibilities.

title: Former BJP MP’s remarks worry party leadership in poll-bound Bihar

title: Steelers eye Tyreek Hill trade; Dolphins might engage; insider reveals drama
description: Tyreek Hill's future with the Miami Dolphins is uncertain amidst a messy divorce and domestic abuse allegations. NFL insider Jeremy Fowler suggests the Pittsburgh Steelers might consider trading for Hill if Miami is open to discussions. However, concerns about the allegations could deter the Steelers, as they might lead to a suspension under the NFL's Personal Conduct Policy.

description: Speculation arose about a potential handshake snub between India and Bangladesh after their Asia Cup match. Visuals confirmed the teams exchanged handshakes, maintaining sporting spirit. Abhishek Sharma's explosive innings and strong bowling performances led India to victory. India secured a spot in the final. Bangladesh will face Pakistan to determine the other finalist, raising hopes for another India-Pakistan match.

title: Infrastructure push: PM Modi tells bureaucrats to clear bottlenecks; focus on results
description: PM Narendra Modi chaired a Pragati meeting. He urged officials to resolve infrastructure project issues. He asked them not to wait for reviews. The PM emphasized better coordination. He wants faster project execution. He reviewed eight critical projects. These projects cover mines, railways and water resources. The projects span 15 states and UTs. The cumulative investment is over Rs 65,000 crore.

title: Asia Cup | India in final: Red-hot Abhishek Sharma blasts 37-ball 75 to dismantle Bangladesh
description: Abhishek Sharma’s blazing 37-ball 75 powered India into the Asia Cup final with a 41-run win over Bangladesh in Dubai. His assault set the tone as India posted 168/6, before Kuldeep Yadav, Varun Chakaravarthy and Jasprit Bumrah dismantled Bangladesh for 127. Saif Hassan’s lone 69 wasn’t enough as India sealed back-to-back wins in the Super Four stage of the tournament.

description: Jammu and Kashmir Police have apprehended Mohammad Kataria, a Kulgam resident, for allegedly aiding the Pakistan-backed terrorists involved in the deadly April 22 Pahalgam attack that killed 26 tourists. Kataria is accused of providing crucial logistical support to the terrorists.

description: India secured their Asia Cup 2025 final berth with a dominant 41-run victory over Bangladesh in Dubai, despite Sanju Samson's mixed performance, where he dropped a catch and didn't get to bat. Suryakumar Yadav's team posted 168/6, powered by Abhishek Sharma's explosive 75, while Bangladesh faltered in their chase, managing only 127.

title: Bill Gates credits 15 Indian engineers, says they built Microsoft; viral video
description: Amidst H-1B visa fee hikes and debates, a resurfaced video shows Bill Gates recalling Microsoft's early recruitment of Indian engineers from IITs in the 1980s. Gates emphasizes that this decision was crucial for Microsoft's growth, despite initial criticism about brain drain and concerns over American jobs.

title: Agassi–Graf 2025 net worth: Inside tennis power couple’s fortune
description: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf, tennis legends with a combined fortune of $290 million in 2025, continue to impact the sport. Agassi captained Team World to victory at the Laver Cup, while Graf dedicates her time to family and charitable endeavors. Their children, Jaden and Jaz, were seen supporting their father at the Laver Cup, highlighting their enduring family legacy.

title: Gabrielle Union: ‘No job is worth unease’—on Hollywood’s dark side
description: Popular actress Gabrielle Union revealed how a past sexual assault shaped her Hollywood career. She avoids projects with unsettling individuals, prioritizing her well-being. Union values positive environments over financial gain. Despite past trauma, she achieved success. Her marriage to Dwyane Wade is strong. The couple focuses on family and business ventures. Wade supports Union, and they navigate life together.
